pgoods.ingredients:
Connective tissues are fibrous tissues 
 They are made up of cells separated by non-living material which is called an extracellular matrix 
 Connective tissue gives shape to organs and holds them in place 
 Both blood and bone are examples of connective tissue

Processed Wood Pulp Used to make paper from softwood trees 
 In na we use virgin wood pulp our products don’t contain recycled fibers 
 Wet strength polymer added to increase strength during wet use 
 Adhesive	hold pliestogether Present in trace amounts 
 Ceteareth-10 surfactant emulsifier

Page size and style

 cover art/illustrations
Our signature dough envelopes your favorite ingredients

The first step in the process of making soft tissue paper is creating paper pulp 
 Which can be generated from wood fibre or recycled materials 
 Trees are logged and cut into chips which are then ground into fine flakes

Paper is a thin material produced by pressing together moist fibres of cellulose pulp derived from wood 
 Rags or grasses 
  And drying them into flexible sheets 
 It is a versatile material with many uses 
 including writing 
 Printing packaging 
 Cleaning and a number of industrial and construction processes

The ballpoint pen 
 The felt-tip marker 
 And the fibre-tip pen have led to inks containing solutions of dyes in water or organic solvents such as propylene glycol 
 Propyl alcohol 
 Toluene or glyco-ethers 
 Other ingredients like resins 
 Preservatives and wetting agents are also added

 Affect odor as well as prevent sweating by affecting sweat glands
